decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the 21/03/2011, which is the date of the original planning permission under LBE ref: P/2010/4201.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to ensure that this planning permission under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 does not extend the length of the permission. | Details and samples of all facing materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any work commencing on the superstructure.  The samples and details shall include:  a) brickwork (including brick panels and mortar courses); b) stone cladding; c) glass cladding; d) all window treatments (including sections and reveals); e) render panels and colours; f) portico details; g) balcony structures and balustrading treatment (including sections);  h) privacy screen treatment;  i) residential and energy centre entrance doors;  j) entrance gates to the undercroft car parking area;  k) any other materials to be used.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  In the interest of securing sustainable development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development is of a high standard in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011, and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the privacy screens to be provided for the balconies and winter gardens shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works and the details so approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the dwelling it serves and shall not thereafter be altered, replaced or removed except with the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.    Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall be commenced unless and until details of the retention and adequate protection of all trees and tree root systems within, bordering and adjacent to the site have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and enacted (retention/protection shall be in accordance with BS 5837, 2005 'Trees in Relation to Construction').  The details shall include a site plan identifying all trees to be retained and removed including the location of Root Protection Area (RPA) and Construction Exclusion Zone (CEZ) and the erection of the hoarding.  Tree protecting fencing shall consist of a rigid 2.4 metre high hoarding.  Heras fencing in concrete, rubber or similar foot plates are not acceptable as a form of tree root protection.  Reason:  To safeguard the future of these trees and shrubs in the interests of the visual amenities and the biodiversity value of the area and the setting and character of the proposed development in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved full details of all tree pits; their locations, dimensions and depths in relation to ground levels, underground services, car-parking bays and hard landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any works commencing on site. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.  Reason:  To secure the appropriate provision and development of the proposed street-trees and to ensure that the life of the trees would not be unduly constrained in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details submitted within the Landscape and Play Space Strategy (Rev A, prepared by HTA), details of the location, species and size of the eleven (11) replacement street trees shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Street trees shall be provided in accordance with the approved details and shall be planted during the first planting season following practical completion of the development hereby approved.  Any trees or shrubs that die within five years of planting or within such time before the adoption of such areas by the Local Highway Authority, whichever is the earlier, shall be replaced with the same species or an approved alternative and to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority during the next planting season.  Reason:  To ensure the approved replacement street tree planting is provided as an integral feature of the development in the interests of the setting of the buildings and visual amenities of the locality and to provide biodiversity within the site in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the biodiversity (green / brown) roofs proposed and the measures within the design of the building to support such provision shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of substructure works. These details shall include:   a) biodiversity and / or sedum based with extensive substrate base covering the extent of the roof surface where achievable and reasonable;  b) sufficient depth of soil or growing medium for the relevant planting; c) planted / seeded with an agreed mix of species within the first planting season following the practical completion of the building works; d) relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation.  The green roofs shall not be used as an amenity or sitting out area and shall only be used in the case of essential maintenance or repair.  The biodiversity roofs shall be provided strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with policies 5.10, 5.11 and 5.12 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 3.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A landscaping scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any superstructure works commencing on site.  The detailed landscaping scheme, which shall include details of the street level landscaping, living walls, homezone, podium level communal garden and roof terraces, shall include the following details:   a) an Access Statement detailing routes from the relevant areas of car parking, building entrances and through the landscape and the facilities it provides; b) a biodiversity statement detailing how the landscaping scheme maximises biodiversity; c) existing and proposed underground services and their relationship to both hard and soft landscaping; d) proposed trees: their location, species and size; e) soft plantings: including grass and turf areas, shrub and herbaceous areas; f) topographical survey: including earthworks, ground finishes, top soiling with both conserved and imported topsoil(s), levels, drainage and fall in drain types;  g) enclosures within the communal courtyard: including types, dimensions and treatments of walls, fences, screen walls, barriers, rails, retaining walls and hedges; h) hard landscaping: including ground surfaces, kerbs, edges, ridge and flexible pavings, unit paving, seating furniture, steps and if applicable synthetic surfaces;  i) the design, number and siting of bird and bat boxes; j) any other landscaping feature(s) forming part of the scheme; and k) work phasing plan.  All landscaping in accordance with the approved scheme shall be completed / planted during the first planting season following practical completion of the development hereby approved or in accordance with the approved work phasing plan.  Any trees or shrubs that die within five years of completion of the development shall be replaced with the same species or an approved alternative and to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority in the next planting season.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and shall be maintained as such thereafter.   Reason:  To ensure the approved landscaping is provided as an integral feature of the development and suitable structural support for such landscaping is provided and that all such landscaping is retained in the interests of the setting of the buildings and visual amenities of the locality and to provide biodiversity within the site in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved details indicating the positions, appearance, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected on the site, shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason:  To protect the appearance of the area and the amenity of residents of the development in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the rainwater harvesting and recycling system shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any superstructure works commencing on the development. The details shall also demonstrate the maximum level of recycled water that can feasibly be provided to the development and how and where it will be used.   The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To ensure the sustainable use of water in accordance with policy 5.13 and 5.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 2.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Footpaths from the public highway to the entrance of the relevant part of the development shall be provided before the first occupation of residential units within the relevant part of the development. Footpaths shall be provided in accordance with the approved layout and completed and surfaced in accordance with the approved hard surfacing details and work phase plan required by condition 8 of this planning permission.  Reason:  To ensure safe and adequate access is provided to the building in the interest of the residents and visitors to the development in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking spaces within the undercroft, on the western side of All Saints Road, and within the parking court to the south of the building, as indicated on the approved plans, shall be marked out and completed in accordance with a phasing strategy to be submitted to the Local Planning Authority within six months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The car parking spaces in the undercroft and within the car parking court to the south of the approved building, together with the associated access roads and manoeuvring areas, shall be kept continuously available for car and motorcycle parking and shall not be used for any other purpose unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure adequate car parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in the interests of the general amenities of the locality and the free flow of traffic and conditions of pedestrian and general highway safety on the neighbouring highways in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of the of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of a scheme to provide a minimum of 20% of the parking spaces within the undercroft car park with active charging points for electric vehicles, with an additional 20% of spaces being provided with passive charging provision or suitable alternative provision, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and the approved details shall be implemented in accordance with a phasing strategy to be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development.  Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011. | The dedicated bicycle storage enclosures shown on the approved drawings within the eight storage areas shall be provided and ready for use prior to the first occupation of any dwelling in the relevant core of the building and these bicycle storage areas shall only be used for bicycle parking and for no other purpose unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The dedicated refuse / recycling enclosures shown on the approved drawings shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any dwelling in the relevant core of the building. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To secure the necessary physical waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the route providing unimpeded access for refuse and recycling collection from the enclosure serving proposed Block 6 (as indicated on approved drawing SAE-AL-110 Rev C) to the closest point for collection shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the marking out of car parking along the western side of All Saints Road, required in accordance with the relevant condition herein.   Reason: To secure the necessary access requirements for refuse and recycling collection to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of any development, details of a site construction method statement/ management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following: a) on-site construction worker parking; b) anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site; c) delivery times and booking system (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods); d) site access for construction traffic and contractor staff parking and associated signage; e) consolidated or re-timed trips; f) dust suppression measures to the standards set out in the 'Best Practice Guidance: The control of dust and emissions from construction and demolition'; g) wheel washing provisions; h) site security; i) secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities; j) vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear; k) details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices; l) procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents; m) cyclists , disabled people and the local schools will need to be consulted, with regard  deliveries & diversions; n) a commitment , to be part of  Considerate Construction Scheme; o) using TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed, in accordance with approved detail, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved under LBE planning ref: P/2011/2582, dated 15/08/2011 shall be taken as satisfying the submission requirements of this condition.   Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 4.4, 4.5, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A Green Procurement Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is commenced. The Green Procurement Plan shall demonstrate how the procurement of materials for the development will promote sustainability, including by use of low impact, sustainably sourced, reused and recycled materials, including reuse of demolition waste. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the particulars so approved in this Plan.  The details approved under LBE planning ref: P/2011/2585, dated 16/09/2011 shall be taken as satisfying the submission requirements of this condition.  Reason:  To ensure sustainable procurement of materials which minimises the negative environmental impacts of construction in accordance with policies 5.3 and 5.18 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.1, 2.10, and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All of the residential properties shall be built to Lifetime Homes Standards.  Confirmation that these standards have been met shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development.  The confirmation shall take the form of an accommodation schedule documenting, in relation to each dwelling, how the Lifetime Homes Standards have been met. The development shall be constructed strictly in accordance with the details so approved.    Reason:  To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers of the residential accommodation, in accordance with policy 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | The 16 number wheelchair dedicated / wheelchair adaptable housing units hereby approved shall be provided as part of the development prior to the first occupation of the building to which they form part.   Prior to the first occupation of the development, the following audit shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:  a) an as built Wheelchair Accessible Housing checklist completed by a suitably qualified 3rd party.  The development shall be constructed strictly in accordance with the details so approved and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.    Reason:  To ensure provision of wheelchair housing as agreed, in a timely fashion and which would address the backlog of and current unmet housing needs; produce a sustainable mix of accommodation; and provide appropriate choices and housing opportunities for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8, and 3.9 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All lifts serving the dwellings hereby approved shall be installed and operational in the relevant building core prior to the first occupation of the residential dwellings served by that core. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To ensure that adequate access is provided to the residential units at all floors of the development in accordance with policy 3.5, 3.8, and 3.11 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the street lighting, other external lighting and a programme of installation shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The approved lighting shall thereafter be provided prior to the first occupation of any dwelling within the programmed installation phases and maintained in accordance with the approved details.  Reason:  To provide suitable lighting for the safety of residents and visitors to the development and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of residential properties within and adjacent to the development, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings containing flats hereby permitted unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To safeguard the appearance of the buildings in the interests of visual amenity; in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of crime prevention and security measures for the buildings, car parking areas, cycle parking areas (including access controls to the car park and entrance doors), hard and soft landscaped areas and bin storage areas, shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within six months of the commencement of the superstructure works.  The details shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the relevant building core and shall be retained in perpetuity.  Reason: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the living conditions of the future occupiers, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: 'Safer Ealing'. | Prior to commencement of development on the site, other than site preparation works, site remediation or the formation of accesses, a detailed Energy Strategy shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing and the approved strategy shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development and maintained in perpetuity. The Energy Strategy shall be based on either of the two preferred energy strategies outlined within the Energy Statement (Rev 4) prepared by AECOM, being either 1) connecting the development to the neighbouring energy centre, or 2) installation of a 15kWe CHP unit combined with photovoltaics.   The Energy Strategy shall demonstrate that the scheme reduces the building's modelled carbon dioxide emissions by the minimum requirements of the Part L 2010 Building Regulations, and that the carbon dioxide emissions associated with the total energy consumption of the building (regulated + unregulated energy) are reduced by at least 7% beyond the Part L 2010 Building Regulations compliant base case, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved under LBE planning ref: P/2011/2632, dated 06/09/2011 shall be taken as satisfying the submission requirements of this condition.   Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements in accordance with policies 2.9 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5 and 5.6 of the London Plan 2011. | Unless an alternative energy strategy is agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority, details of the gas combined heat and power facility, which shall provide no less than 15kWe capacity including:  a) its location; specification and operation/management strategy; b) flue location, height and design; and  c) the method of how the facility shall be designed to allow for the future connection to any decentralised heating and hot water network   shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any commencement of works on site and the facility shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the first dwelling within the development hereby approved.    The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved under LBE planning ref: P/2011/2635, dated 06/09/2011 shall be taken as satisfying the submission requirements of this condition.   Reason:    To ensure the facility is provided appropriately and so that it is designed in a manner which allows for the future connection to a district system in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5 and 5.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.9 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'  (2004). | The 240sqm (gross internal area) sized energy centre hereby approved shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter serve all dwellings within the development unless an alternative energy strategy is otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  In the interest of securing the centralised energy centre for the site and its sustainable connection to the development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5 and 5.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.9 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All affordable tenure residential units shall achieve 'Level 4' of the Code for Sustainable Homes and the private sale tenure residential units shall achieve a minimum score of 64.5 of the Code for Sustainable Homes, in accordance with the approved Sustainability Statement (Rev 3, prepared by AECOM). No dwelling within the development shall be occupied prior to the submission of an EPC and code assessors confirmation of unit compliance and a final 'Code Certificate' shall be submitted within 12 months of the completion of works to the Local Planning Authority certifying that the agreed sustainability measures have been achieved.    Reason:  To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.1; 4.1; and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the scheme of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less than 56kWp (equivalent to 7% on-site C02 reduction) as detailed within the Energy Statement (Rev 4) prepared by AECOM, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the development. The approved photovoltaic scheme shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development. The details shall include:  a) The resulting scheme, machinery/apparatus location, specification and operational details;  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.7, and 5.8 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.9 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of noise attenuation measures and associated ventilation within the residential units shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority within 3 months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The submitted detail shall meet the following standards of the Council as detailed within Supplementary planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration': + Bedrooms - not greater than 30dB(A)Leq,1hr (23-00 - 07-00 hours)  + Bedrooms - individual noise events not greater than 45 dB LAmax (fast time weighting) + Living rooms and dining rooms - not greater than 35dB(A)Leq,1hr (07-00 -23-00 hours)   Reason: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: Noise and Vibration. | Details to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: Noise and Vibration. | Notwithstanding the provision of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no development to any dwelling house hereby approved under Classes A, B, C, D or, E of Part 1, Schedule 2 to the said Order shall be carried out or constructed without express planning permission.   Reason:  To ensure that the Local Planning Authority has control over future extensions, alterations and other works to the dwelling houses to maintain their architectural integrity and design in view of the limited space within the site available for such works and the impact such works and extensions may have on the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The scheme for surface water attenuation and sustainable urban drainage system (SUDS) measures of no less than those identified in the submitted Flood Risk Assessment (prepared by WSP, revision 3, dated October 2010) shall be implemented before the development is completed and these systems shall be managed and maintained in perpetuity, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  To minimise the risk of floo
site_name: Land Adj To Bollo Bridge Road South Acton
